title: several grave issues with new contacts manager in oc5
body:
up to oc4.5, contact groups were pretty much ignored by oc. partially for organisational reasons but also partially due to this fact, we now use several address books in one oc account. also, we have one "archive" address book there for expired contacts, which is disabled by default.

after the upgrade from oc4.5 to oc5, we found the following, severe problems with the all-new group-centric approach:

1. different address books can no longer be displayed separately like before, not even by clicking on their name. their contents are indistinguishably merged in the "all" group view.
2. due to 1. contacts can no longer be moved from one address book to another. (removed functionality)
3. due to 1. contacts can no longer be added to specific address books. (removed functionality)
4. the contents of disabled address books become inaccessible after the upgrade. this is roughly equivalent to a data loss and therefor inacceptable.
5. contact groups of the inaccessible contacts from 3. will show up as undeletable "ghost" groups with invisible contacts in them.
6. address books can no longer be temporarily disabled. (removed functionality)

i would like to stress that such a grave shift in the contacts management paradigm surely might have its good reasons. nevertheless it looks like there has been not much thinking about the fact that this might have severe implications on existing user data and the way users need  things to work. adding support for groups is a good thing. removing almost any support for managing more than one address book is a bad thing. you should at least have thought about providing a migration path like e.g. offering a tool to auto-merge all address books in an account and add their contents to groups named accordingly.
